intro: Casselia bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate casselia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its fruit is a small, round drupe that contains a single seed. Casselia bracteata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
